channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: An Intense White House Response From a Single Viral Video
item.description: A video purporting to expose extensive fraud at child care centers in Minnesota shows the relationship between the Trump administration and self-descr...

item.title: Justice Dept. Is Now Said to Be Reviewing 5.2 Million Pages of Epstein Files
item.description: The number represents a more precise, and potentially much larger, figure than earlier estimates. The department is seeking to enlist about 400 lawyer...

item.title: Even as Trump Targets Boats in Strikes, Coast Guard Continues Anti-Drug Operations
item.description: Cutters are still stopping smugglers and seizing drugs, but the prosecutions of go-fast boat crews are dwindling in a realignment of federal resources...

item.title: Trump Spent the Past Year Trying to Crush Dissent
item.description: The next three years will require a vigilant defense of free speech and open debate.

item.title: New Year’s Eve Forecast Is Very Cold Across the U.S.
item.description: Some of the season’s most frigid temperatures are expected this week.

item.title: How We Tracked Abuses in the Russian Army
item.description: President Vladimir Putin has claimed that the Russian society can tolerate the high human cost of the war in Ukraine. But we’ve analyzed more than 6,0...

item.title: How Thousands of Secret Russian Documents Were Exposed
item.description: Russian journalists learned that a government office inadvertently made thousands of sensitive complaints viewable online, including accounts of abuse...

item.title: Phone Searches at U.S. Borders: What Travelers Need to Know
item.description: Customs agents have broad authority to search the electronic devices of travelers entering and leaving the U.S. Here are tips for keeping your data sa...

item.title: Thailand Releases 18 Cambodian P.O.W.s
item.description: The repatriation of the Cambodian soldiers captured in July comes on the heels of a 72-hour cease-fire that could end months of border skirmishes.

item.title: How Russia’s War Machine Brutalizes and Exploits Its Own Soldiers
item.description: Confidential complaints filed by troops and their families reveal patterns of wrongdoing in the ranks that are hidden from the Russian public.

item.title: Buddhist monks peace-walking from Texas to DC persist even after being run over on highway outside Houston
item.description: One of the monks had “substantial leg injuries” and was flown by helicopter to a hospital in Houston, Dayton Interim Police Chief Shane Burleigh said.

item.title: Tatiana Schlossberg, granddaughter of JFK and cousin of Health Secretary RFK Jr., dies of cancer at 35
item.description: Her death comes just weeks after she publicly revealed in The New Yorker that she had been diagnosed with acute myeloid leukemia.

item.title: Meta claims ‘no continuing Chinese ownership interests in Manus AI’ after reported $2 billion deal to shore up in AI agent race
item.description: Manus, a Singapore-based platform with some Chinese roots, launched its first “general-purpose” AI agent earlier this year.

item.title: ‘Our beautiful Tatiana passed away this morning. She will always be in our hearts’: Kennedy family mourns yet another tragic death
item.description: Schlossberg had worked as a reporter covering climate change and the environment for The New York Times’ Science section.

item.title: ‘I opened her door and the wind caught me, and I went flying’: The U.S. Arctic air surge is sweeping northerners off their feet
item.description: Nationwide, more than 115,000 customers were without power Tuesday morning, around a third of them in Michigan, according to Poweroutage.us.
